perturbation.original_text: “Service” means the Advertising Services and the Video Display Program.
perturbation.changed_text: “Service” means exclusively the Advertising Services, explicitly excluding the Video Display Program.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction because the original definition clearly includes the Video Display Program, while the modified definition explicitly excludes it. This affects all obligations and rights tied to the 'Service,' leading to confusion on what is covered by the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, NCM hereby grants to Network Affiliate, and Network Affiliate hereby accepts, a non-exclusive, non-transferable, non-sublicenseable, royalty-free limited license to the object code version of the Software on Equipment at Theatres solely for the limited purpose of performing this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, NCM hereby grants to Network Affiliate, and Network Affiliate hereby accepts, an exclusive, transferable, sublicenseable, royalty-bearing unlimited license to the object code version of the Software on Equipment at Theatres for any purpose, including but not limited to performing this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a direct contradiction. The original text specifies a 'non-exclusive, non-transferable, non-sublicenseable, royalty-free limited license,' while the modified text grants an 'exclusive, transferable, sublicenseable, royalty-bearing unlimited license.' This directly clashes with the intended restrictions on the software usage.

perturbation.original_text: Network Affiliate shall provide to NCM during each month of the Term 25 complimentary Theatre passes that will not expire any earlier than 120 days from the date of issuance. The passes shall be provided to NCM at least 30 days prior to the month in which such passes first become valid.
perturbation.changed_text: Network Affiliate may provide to NCM during each month of the Term up to 5 complimentary Theatre passes that will expire within 30 days from the date of issuance. The provision of passes is subject to Network Affiliate’s discretion, and passes are given on a 'best efforts' basis. The passes shall be provided to NCM within 5 days prior to the month in which such passes first become valid.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces conflicting terms regarding the number, expiration, obligation, and timing of providing theater passes. The original text states 'shall provide 25', while the modified text says 'may provide up to 5', creating ambiguity about Network Affiliate's obligations and NCM's entitlements.
perturbation.location: Section 11.4 - ARTICLE XI - ADDITIONAL RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS
